BROOK: To use; enjoy; have the full employment of.
CLEMENTINE: A type of small, sweet orange, the result of a cross between a tangerine and Seville orange.
HOLLY: Any of various shrubs or (mostly) small trees, of the genus Ilex, either evergreen or deciduous, used as decoration especially at Christmas.
LAUREL: Laurus nobilis, an evergreen shrub having aromatic leaves of a lanceolate shape, with clusters of small, yellowish white flowers in their axils.
RIVER: A large and often winding stream which drains a land mass, carrying water down from higher areas to a lower point, oftentimes ending in another body of water, such as an ocean or in an inland sea.
WILLOW: Any of various deciduous trees or shrubs in the genus Salix, in the ______ family Salicaceae, found primarily on moist soils in cooler zones in the northern hemisphere.
